CIT_rate.title: Top statutory corporate income tax rate
CIT_rate.description: Top statutory corporate income tax rate

CIT_rate_ded.title: Marginal corporate income tax rate applied to deductions
CIT_rate_ded.description: Top statutory corporate income tax rate

pt_entity_tax_ind.title: Pass-through business entity-level tax indicator
pt_entity_tax_ind.description: Indicator variable indicating whether or not there is an entity-level tax on pass-through businesses. This tax is levied on entity-level profits.  Owners also pay individual income taxes on the distributions.
pt_entity_tax_ind.notes: Note that is this indicator is True, then the METR calculation for pass-through businesses will represent the effects of the entity-level tax and not the indvidiual-level tax.  This is becaue the METR represents the effective tax rate from the first layer of taxation.  The statutory rate on pass-through entities is set with the pt_entity_tax_rate parameter.

pt_entity_tax_rate.title: Statutory income tax rate on pass-through business income levied at the entity level
pt_entity_tax_rate.description: Statutory income tax rate on pass-through business income levied at the entity level.

pt_scale_tax_rate_ded.title: Ratio of marginal tax rate on deductions by pass-through businesses to marginal tax rate on their income
pt_scale_tax_rate_ded.description: Ratio of marginal tax rate on deductions by pass-through businesses to marginal tax rate on their income

BonusDeprec_3yr.title: Bonus depreciation rate on 3-year class property
BonusDeprec_3yr.description: Bonus depreciation rate on 3-year class property.

BonusDeprec_5yr.description: Bonus depreciation rate on 5-year class property.

BonusDeprec_7yr.description: Bonus depreciation rate on 7-year class property.

BonusDeprec_27_5yr.description: Bonus depreciation rate on 27.5-year class property.

BonusDeprec_39yr.title: Bonus depreciation rate on 39-year class property
BonusDeprec_39yr.description: Bonus depreciation rate on 39-year class property.

ace_c.title: Allowance for corporate equity.
ace_c.description: Allowance for corporate equity (fraction of equity deductible)
ace_c.notes: This parameter gives the allowance for corporate equity (ACE). Under an ACE system, companies can deduct a notional interest on their equity.  The default rate used in Cost-of-Capital-Calculator is the nominal interest rate on corporate debt.  Moving this parameter up from zero allows the corporate to have partial to full deductibility of the notional interest on equity.

ace_pt.title: Allowance for non-corporate equity
ace_pt.description: Allowance for non-corporate equity (fraction of equity deductible).
ace_pt.notes: This parameter gives the allowance for non-corporate equity (ACE). Only relevant if there is an entity-level tax on pass-through businesses (pt_entity_tax_ind=True).  Under an ACE system, companies can deduct a notional interest on their equity.  The default rate used in Cost-of-Capital-Calculator is the nominal interest rate on corporate debt.  Moving this parameter up from zero allows the corporate to have partial to full deductibility of the notional interest on equity.

ace_int_rate.title: Notional interest rate on the allowance for corporate equity
ace_int_rate.description: Notional interest rate on the allowance for corporate equity.
ace_int_rate.notes: The default rate used in Cost-of-Capital-Calculator is the nominal interest rate on corporate debt.  Moving this parameter up from zero allows the corporate to have partial to full deductibility of the notional interest on equity.

interest_deduct_haircut_c.title: Haircut on interest deductibility for corporate entities
interest_deduct_haircut_c.description: Haircut on interest deductibility (fraction of interest not deductible) for C corporations.  Default of 0% because current law says limit is 30% of adjusted taxable income and the default assumption is that this is not binding for the marginal investment.
interest_deduct_haircut_c.notes: This parameter gives the fraction of interest payments that are not allowable as deductions against income for C corporations.

interest_deduct_haircut_pt.title: Haircut on interest deductibility for pass-through entities
interest_deduct_haircut_pt.description: Haircut on interest deductibility (fraction of interest not deductible) for pass-through entities.
interest_deduct_haircut_pt.notes: This parameter gives the fraction of interest payments that are not allowable as deductions against income for pass-through entities.

inv_tax_credit.title: Investment tax credit
inv_tax_credit.section_1: Investment Tax Credits and Property Tax
inv_tax_credit.notes: The investment tax credit rate gives the rate at which the cost of new investments are credited against the firm's tax liability.

re_credit_asset.title: Research and experimentation tax credit
re_credit_asset.description: Effective research and experimentation tax credit rate for asset types.
re_credit_asset.section_1: Investment Tax Credits and Property Tax
re_credit_asset.notes: This parameter captures the effective research and experimentation tax credit rate. Therefore, the value of this parameter will differ from the statutory rate based on the amount of investment that is eligible for the credit. Also note that this parameter specifies the R&E credit by eligible asset. See re_credit_industry for R&E credits assigned by industry.

re_credit_industry.title: Research and experimentation tax credit
re_credit_industry.description: Effective research and experimentation tax credit rate for certain industries.
re_credit_industry.section_1: Investment Tax Credits and Property Tax
re_credit_industry.notes: This parameter captures the effective research and experimentation tax credit rate. Therefore, the value of this parameter will differ from the statutory rate based on the amount of investment that is eligible for the credit.

psi.title: Share of investment tax credit that can't be claimed for cost recovery
psi.description: Share of investment tax credit that can't be claimed for cost recovery
psi.section_1: Investment Tax Credits and Property Tax
psi.notes: This parameter gives the share of the investment tax credit that can't also be claimed for cost recovery.  Some policies allow the credit to not offset the basis of the investment (or only partially do so).  Setting this parameter to a value < 1 will do that.

nu.title: NPV of the investment tax credit per unit of investment
nu.description: NPV of the investment tax credit per unit of investment
nu.section_1: Investment Tax Credits and Property Tax
nu.notes: For cases when the rate of return is ntn constant and losses prevent use of ITC immediately, this parameter will reflect the lower NPV of the credit by taking a value < 1.

property_tax.title: Property tax rate
property_tax.section_1: Investment Tax Credits and Property Tax

phi.title: Fraction of inventories that are accounted for using LIFO
phi.description: Fraction of inventories that are accounted for using LIFO.
phi.notes: Fraction of inventories that are accounted for using LIFO.

inventory_expensing.title: Indicator for whether inventories are immediately expensed
inventory_expensing.description: Indicator for whether inventories are immediately expensed.
inventory_expensing.notes: Indicator for whether inventories are immediately expensed.

tau_pt.notes: Effective marginal tax rate on business income to pass-through business owners.  Computed from Tax-Calculator vX.X.X using the 2009 PUF.

tau_td.description: Effective marginal tax rate on assets held in tax-deferred accounts.
tau_td.notes: Effective marginal tax rate on assets held in tax-deferred accounts.  Default value from CBO (2014)

tau_h.title: Effective marginal tax rate on owner occupied housing deductions
tau_h.description: Effective marginal tax rate on owner occupied housing deductions.
tau_h.notes: Effective marginal tax rate on owner occupied housing deductions.  Computed from Tax-Calculator vX.X.X using the 2009 PUF.

tau_w.title: Effective marginal tax rate on wealth
tau_w.description: Effective marginal tax rate on wealth.
tau_w.notes: Effective marginal tax rate on wealth.  Computed as a weighted average across the population.

inflation_rate.title: Inflation rate
inflation_rate.notes: The default inflation rate is determined by the forecast of the Congressional Budget Office (CBO) for the PCE price index.

nominal_interest_rate.title: Nominal interest rate paid on business debt
nominal_interest_rate.description: Nominal interest rate paid on business debt.
nominal_interest_rate.notes: The default nominal interest rate is taken as the yeild on BBB corporate bonds.  Default value taken from CBO (2014): https://www.cbo.gov/sites/default/files/113th-congress-2013-2014/reports/49817-taxingcapitalincome0.pdf

m.title: Share of equity return retained by the firm and reinvested
m.description: The share of the real equity return retained by the firm and reinvested
m.notes: The share of the real equity return retained by the firm and reinvested.  Default value taken from 1 - dividend payout rate reported in CBO (2014): https://www.cbo.gov/sites/default/files/113th-congress-2013-2014/reports/49817-taxingcapitalincome0.pdf

profit_rate.title: Profit rate used when computing EATR

new_view.title: Whether or not use the new view of dividend taxation
new_view.description: Whether or not use the new view of dividend taxation.
new_view.notes: Under the new view of dividend taxation, dividend taxes do not influence investment decisions.  Under the old view, they do.
